title: Beginner Essentials
description: Test your knowledge of the most basic and essential French connectors. Perfect for A1 learners starting their French journey.

questions.explanation: 'Et' (and) is used to connect two items in a list. The most basic connector in French.

questions.sentence: J'aime le chocolat, ___ je n'aime pas les bonbons.
questions.explanation: 'Mais' (but) introduces a contrast. You like chocolate BUT not candy.
questions.translation: I like chocolate, but I don't like candy.

questions.sentence: Je reste à la maison ___ il pleut.
questions.explanation: 'Parce que' (because) explains the reason. You stay home BECAUSE it's raining.
questions.translation: I stay home because it's raining.

questions.sentence: Tu veux du thé ___ du café ?
questions.explanation: 'Ou' (or) presents a choice between two options. Tea OR coffee?
questions.translation: Do you want tea or coffee?

questions.explanation: 'Quand' (when) is used to ask about time. WHEN are you arriving?

questions.sentence: Il aime le sport ___ la musique.
questions.explanation: 'Et' (and) connects two things that are both true. He likes sports AND music.

questions.sentence: Je suis fatigué ___ j'ai beaucoup travaillé.
questions.explanation: 'Parce que' (because) explains the cause. You're tired BECAUSE you worked a lot.
questions.translation: I'm tired because I worked a lot.
